name: ssdifd
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0

stmt.origin: syl(w0, wss(cdif(c0, c1), cdif(c2, c1)), wss(c0, c2))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wss(cdif(c0, c1), cdif(c2, c1)))
-| wi(w0, wss(c0, c2))
-| wi(wss(c0, c2), wss(cdif(c0, c1), cdif(c2, c1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wss(cdif(c0, c1), cdif(c2, c1)))
-| wi(w0, wss(c0, c2))
-| wi(wss(c0, c2), wss(cdif(c0, c1), cdif(c2, c1)))

body.origin: |- wi(wss(c0, c2), wss(cdif(c0, c1), cdif(c2, c1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wss(cdif(c0, c1), cdif(c2, c1)))
-| wi(w0, wss(c0, c2))

comment: If ` A ` is contained in ` B ` , then ` ( A \ C ) ` is contained in ` ( B \ C ) ` . Deduction form of ~ ssdif . (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)
